Description: Rim sherd of Attic pottery Saint-Valentin kantharos; interior glazed; exterior: black band at top of rim; below, short diagonal black strokes above black band; below, black upright feather with added white; to right, vertical black band beside black handle zone.
Curator's comments: On Saint-Valentin kantharoi, see ARV2, 984-5; Howard, S. and Johnson, F. P. ‘The Saint-Valentin Vases’, American Journal of Archaeology 58, 1954, 191-207; Moore, M. B., The Athenian Agora XXX, 297-8, nos. 1230-6. For parallels, see British Museum 1867,0508.1201; Boston 89.267 (Howard, S. and Johnson, F.P. ‘The Saint-Valentin Vases’, American Journal of Archaeology 58, 1954, pl. 34); Edinburgh, National Museum of Scotland 1881.44.18 (Boardman, J., Athenian Red Figure Vases: The Classical Period. London 1989, fig. 99).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0746) (Phase 1)
